meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with nails again.
meanings.sent1: I need to renail the loose board on the deck.
meanings.sent2: She decided to renail the painting to the wall.
meanings.sent3: After the windstorm, the house looked like it needed a renailing makeover.
meanings.sent4: His determination to renail their friendship was evident in his actions.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's skillful hands quickly renailed the broken chair back together.

meanings.definition: To attach or affix with nails once more.
meanings.sent1: Please renail the sign to the post so it doesn't fall off.
meanings.sent2: He had to renail the loose shingles on the roof before the rain came.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to renail the acorn to the tree but kept dropping it.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to renail her loyalty to the team by showing up to every game.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully renailed the pieces of the sculpture back together after it fell.
